intro: Bulbostylis fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered bulbostylis, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wetland or marshy environments. The plant produces clusters of tiny, spike-like inflorescences, which are characteristic of the genus Bulbostylis. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often growing close to the ground. This species is native to parts of Africa and is adapted to thrive in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
